actor_awards.notes: A prolific character actor known for his gravelly voice and deadpan delivery. He was a favorite of director Preston Sturges, appearing in ten of his films. He later gained fame as Uncle Charley on the sitcom 'My Three Sons'. Received an Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Jolson Story' (1946).

filmography.title: The Jolson Story
filmography.role_description: The fictionalized mentor and manager of Al Jolson, based on real-life vaudevillians.
filmography.plot: A biography of singer Al Jolson, following his rise from a boy who refuses to follow in his cantor father's footsteps to a superstar.

filmography.title: The Miracle of Morgan's Creek
filmography.role_description: The flustered, hot-tempered father of a pregnant girl who tries to save his family's reputation.
filmography.plot: A small-town girl attends a wild party for departing soldiers and wakes up married and pregnant, sparking a chaotic cover-up.

filmography.title: The Lady Eve
filmography.role_description: The suspicious and protective bodyguard/valet of a wealthy heir, who distrusts the female lead.
filmography.plot: A trio of classy card sharks targets a socially awkward heir to a brewery fortune on an ocean liner.

filmography.title: Sullivan's Travels
filmography.role_description: A cynical studio executive who tries to dissuade the director Sullivan from making a serious film.
filmography.plot: A director of escapist comedies decides to experience life as a hobo to make a socially relevant film.

filmography.title: Hail the Conquering Hero
filmography.role_description: A tough Marine sergeant who helps a discharged soldier fake a hero's return home.
filmography.plot: A man discharged from the Marines for hay fever is mistaken for a war hero by his hometown.

filmography.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
filmography.role_description: The police chief of Santa Rosita who tries to maintain order amidst the chaos of the treasure hunt.
filmography.plot: A group of strangers race across California to find a buried fortune of stolen money.

filmography.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
filmography.role_description: A reporter and friend of the cynical Diz Moore, observing the new senator's arrival.
filmography.plot: A naive man is appointed to fill a vacancy in the U.S. Senate. His plans collide with political corruption, but he doesn't back down.

filmography.title: The Palm Beach Story
filmography.role: First Member Ale and Quail Club
filmography.role_description: A boisterous member of a hunting club traveling on a train who creates chaos for the passengers.
filmography.plot: A married couple struggling with finances decides to divorce so the wife can marry a rich man and fund her husband's architectural dreams.

filmography.title: The Great McGinty
filmography.role_description: A local politician who helps the title character rise from a bum to the governor's mansion.
filmography.plot: A bum is recruited by a crooked political boss to vote multiple times in an election, launching a political career.

filmography.title: Christmas in July
filmography.role_description: A judge in the slogan contest who is skeptical of the winning entry.
filmography.plot: A man mistakenly thinks he has won a large cash prize in a slogan contest and goes on a spending spree.

filmography.title: Jolson Sings Again
filmography.role_description: Demarest reprises his role as Al Jolson's manager in this sequel.
filmography.plot: Al Jolson returns to the stage after retiring, facing new challenges and a changing entertainment landscape.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Story and Screenplay

filmography.title: That Darn Cat!
filmography.role_description: The grumpy, dog-hating neighbor of the owners of the mischievous cat.
filmography.plot: A woman uses her Siamese cat to help the FBI solve a kidnapping case.

filmography.title: Viva Las Vegas
filmography.role_description: The father of the female lead, Rusty Martin (Ann-Margret), who disapproves of her racing driver suitor.
filmography.plot: Race car driver Lucky Jackson goes to Las Vegas to earn money to pay for a new engine for his motor car.

filmography.title: The Jazz Singer
filmography.role_description: A fellow performer and friend to Jack Robin in one of the first 'talkie' films.
filmography.plot: The son of a Jewish Cantor must defy the traditions of his religious father in order to pursue his dream of becoming a jazz singer.

filmography.title: Son of Flubber
filmography.role_description: A character involved in the chaotic events caused by the professor's invention.
filmography.plot: The absent-minded professor invents 'flubber gas' which helps the college football team win the big game.

filmography.title: Escape from Fort Bravo
filmography.role_description: A Confederate prisoner held at a Union fort who participates in an escape attempt.
filmography.plot: During the Civil War, a group of Confederate prisoners escape from a Union fort but are pinned down by Mescalero Indians.

filmography.title: The Far Horizons
filmography.role_description: A sergeant accompanying Lewis and Clark on their expedition across America.
filmography.plot: The story of the Lewis and Clark expedition to explore the newly acquired Louisiana Purchase.

filmography.title: Sorrowful Jones
filmography.role_description: A gambler and friend to the title character, played by Bob Hope.
filmography.plot: A New York bookie ends up with a young girl as collateral for a bet and has to learn to care for her.

filmography.title: Red, Hot and Blue
filmography.role_description: A press agent who gets mixed up in a murder investigation with his actress client.
filmography.plot: An actress trying to make it big gets mixed up with gangsters and a murder mystery.

filmography.title: Along Came Jones
filmography.role_description: A sidekick to the easygoing cowboy protagonist played by Gary Cooper.
filmography.plot: An easygoing cowboy is mistaken for a notorious outlaw and has to rely on the outlaw's girl to save him.

filmography.title: Pardners
filmography.role_description: A supporting character in this Martin and Lewis western comedy.
filmography.plot: Two friends go west to run a ranch and get involved with outlaws and local trouble.

filmography.title: The Private War of Major Benson
filmography.role_description: A character in the comedy about a tough army major assigned to a military school.
filmography.plot: A tough Army major is threatened with discharge unless he can shape up the ROTC program at a Catholic boarding school.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Dangerous When Wet
filmography.role_description: The health-conscious father of a swimming family who travels to England to swim the English Channel.
filmography.plot: A dairy farming family of fitness enthusiasts enters a contest to swim the English Channel.

filmography.title: Easy Living
filmography.role_description: A gossip columnist who spreads rumors about a wealthy banker and a working girl.
filmography.plot: A wealthy banker throws his wife's fur coat out the window, where it lands on a poor working girl, causing everyone to believe she is his mistress.

filmography.title: Pepe
filmography.role_description: A comedic cameo as a studio gateman in this star-studded musical.
filmography.plot: A Mexican ranch hand travels to Hollywood to retrieve his beloved horse.

filmography.title: Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood
filmography.role_description: A cameo in this comedy about Old Hollywood.
filmography.plot: A dog becomes a major movie star in the 1920s, but his human friends struggle with the studio system.
